There is a sleep cycle, depending on which stage you are when you awake, you feel different.
- light sleep -> on form, ready for your day
- deep sleep -> tired, want to go back to sleep
- "dream" sleep -> remember your last dream

One complete cycle lasts about 1 hour and a half, so try to awake at the end of one of those cycles.
For example, set your alarm to sleep 7h30 or 9h, you'll feel more rested than if you slept 8h.

You're not actually a light sleeper, its just that whenever something loud or noisy happens, you just happen to be in a REM stage which is naturally a light sleep for all people. Its just your bad luck that whenever something disruptive comes, your in a sleep cycle that is relatively light.

It should be noted, however, that in this specific study the participants did not know what they were consuming, and were given something before each race (a placebo, in one case, and beetroot in the other).
